articles.author: Brad Brooks, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Natalie Rupnow, a 15-year-old girl, opened fire in a classroom, fatally shooting a fellow student and a teacher and wounding six other people before killing herself with the handgun, police said.
articles.title: Teenage girl shoots dead fellow student and teacher at Wisconsin school

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada's Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland unexpectedly resigned on Monday, saying she was no longer on the same page with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau about the best path forward for Canada.
articles.title: Canada's finance minister resigns after policy clash with PM Trudeau

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. government deported drug lord Osiel Cardenas Guillen to Mexico on Monday, transferring custody of the ex-leader of the Gulf Cartel to Mexican authorities at the border city of Tijuana, two federal government officials told Reuters.
articles.title: US deports notorious drug lord Osiel Cardenas Guillen to Mexico

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: The AUKUS nuclear-powered submarine partnership with Australia will benefit the United States and is the kind of "burden sharing" deal that President-elect Donald Trump has talked about, U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan said.
articles.title: US national security adviser Sullivan says Trump should like 'burden sharing' AUKUS deal

articles.author: Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russia is boosting its ballistic arsenal with new strategic missile systems, plans maximum-range launches and may increase testing in response to growing external threats, a senior Russian military commander said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia to boost its ballistic arsenal with new missiles and testing, commander says

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen
articles.description: A judge on Monday ruled that Donald Trump's conviction for falsifying records to cover up a sex scandal should stand, rejecting the U.S. president-elect's argument that a recent Supreme Court ruling nullified the verdict, a court filing showed.
articles.title: Judge denies Trump's bid to throw out hush money conviction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's acting president Han Duck-soo on Tuesday called for next year's government budget to be swiftly implemented from the start of 2025 in order to help revive the country's slowing economy.
articles.title: South Korea acting president Han calls for speedy implementation of 2025 budget

articles.author: Timothy Gardner, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: The United States hit North Korea and Russia on Monday with new sanctions targeting Pyongyang's financial and military support to Moscow as well as its ballistic missile program.
articles.title: US hits North Korea and Russia with new sanctions, Treasury says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's HUR military spy agency said on Monday that North Korean units fighting for Russia sustained losses of at least 30 soldiers killed or wounded around several villages on the front in Russia's Kursk region over the weekend.
articles.title: Ukraine reports North Korean losses on Russia's Kursk front

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: The head of a U.S.-based Syrian advocacy organization on Monday said that a mass grave outside of Damascus contained the bodies of at least 100,000 people killed by the former government of ousted President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: At least 100,000 bodies in Syrian mass grave, US advocacy group head says
